analysis:
This is an absolute disgrace. jamesclarkson96 has bottled it completely. You're sitting there in 14th place, your team's a shambles, and you decide to trade away two young lads with proper potential for what? A 32-year-old has-been and spare parts? It's criminal. Kareem Hunt's performing, he's in Kansas City's system, he's reliable - and you bin him off. Xavier Worthy and Keon Coleman are 22 years old! They're just starting their careers! You don't give up on developing talent when you're already in the gutter. That's when you BUILD. But no, you've taken the coward's way out, grabbed some short-term rubbish, and made yourself worse. The numbers don't lie - you lost over 2,000 in value and your power score dropped. Shocking stuff.

BigBishAl76 has absolutely mugged you off here. This reminds me of when the Raiders traded Khalil Mack to the Bears - one team thinking short-term, the other playing chess while their opponent's playing checkers. Al's sitting pretty in 2nd place, knows exactly what he needs, and he's swindled you into giving him a productive running back and two young receivers for absolute pennies. He's upgraded his depth, added a reliable RB2 in Hunt who's actually IMPROVED post-trade, and he's barely touched his starting lineup. Meanwhile, Jordan Mason's production fell off a cliff after you got him. Ray-Ray McCloud? He's not even on a team anymore! You've been had, son.

Here's my prediction: In two years, Xavier Worthy and Keon Coleman will be established starters in this league, Hunt will have retired having won BigBishAl76 a championship this season, and jamesclarkson96 will still be wandering around the bottom half wondering what went wrong. This is what happens when you panic, when you don't have a plan, when you make decisions out of desperation instead of discipline. Al's created a rivalry here alright - he's established himself as the shark and you as the minnow. You don't recover from getting fleeced this badly. Embarrassing. Absolutely embarrassing.
